repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This is an attempt to implement #3349. 
As I am not super familiar with the Cython code base I hope to get feedback and suggestions for improvement.

* Not all comments in the code have been updated yet
* I will add more tests but we'd need a way to really use a GPU in the CI.

comment_data.body: I'm not hugely keen on this - it seems to be complicating what should be a simple flag, and (unless I've missed something) this seems like you could just use "False" for the on-device bits.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2129,7 +2129,7 @@ def put_xdecref_clear(self, cname, type, nanny=True, clear_before_decref=False):
                          clear=True, clear_before_decref=clear_before_decref)
 
     def _put_decref(self, cname, type, nanny=True, null_check=False,
-                    have_gil=True, clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):
+                    have_gil='gil', clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):

comment_data.body:
1. Have you missed a `return node`?
2. Given that this is (otherwise) the same as `visit_ParallelWithBlockNode` could you avoid duplication by calling that (or possibly inheritance)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1069,6 +1069,14 @@ def visit_ParallelWithBlockNode(self, node):
 
         return node
 
+    def visit_DeviceWithBlockNode(self, node):

comment_data.body: This seems like it might fit better in MarkParallelAssignments?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2210,6 +2235,33 @@ def visit_ClassDefNode(self, node):
 
 class AnalyseExpressionsTransform(CythonTransform):
 
+    def __init__(self, context):
+        super(AnalyseExpressionsTransform, self).__init__(context)
+        self.parallel_with_block = None
+
+    def visit_SingleAssignmentNode(self, node):

comment_data.body: I don't know if these ones are suitable, but if you include the (longer) code fragments from doc/examples then they get tested. This at least ensures the documentation is kind of true.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,196 @@
+.. highlight:: cython
+
+.. _device_offload:
+
+********************************
+Offloading to a Device
+********************************
+
+Basic Usage
+===========
+
+Cython supports offloading code blocks to a GPU device.
+Currently only parallel blocks (see :ref:'Using Parallelism <parallel>')
+can be offloaded to a target device. The current implementation is based
+on the OpenMP 'target' directive.
+
+.. NOTE:: The offload functionality is experimental.
+
+.. NOTE:: Offloading to a device is only possible for code blocks which
+          do not require the Python interpreter. There is no way to use
+          Python objects on the device.
+
+Let's consider a simple example for computing pairwise distances between vectors in ``parallel``::
+
+    def pairwise_distance_host(double[:, ::1] X):

comment_data.body: Unfortunately not. Even with nogil Cython generates checks that are useful on a CPU but not so much (or better impractical) on a GPU/device. See below diff (put_incref_memoryviewslice).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2129,7 +2129,7 @@ def put_xdecref_clear(self, cname, type, nanny=True, clear_before_decref=False):
                          clear=True, clear_before_decref=clear_before_decref)
 
     def _put_decref(self, cname, type, nanny=True, null_check=False,
-                    have_gil=True, clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):
+                    have_gil='gil', clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):

comment_data.body: You're right. I will make the changes as suggested.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1069,6 +1069,14 @@ def visit_ParallelWithBlockNode(self, node):
 
         return node
 
+    def visit_DeviceWithBlockNode(self, node):

comment_data.body: I remember I tried (this or something else) in an earlier stage but some information needed was not there yet. I will check if it can be done in MarkParallelAssignments.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2210,6 +2235,33 @@ def visit_ClassDefNode(self, node):
 
 class AnalyseExpressionsTransform(CythonTransform):
 
+    def __init__(self, context):
+        super(AnalyseExpressionsTransform, self).__init__(context)
+        self.parallel_with_block = None
+
+    def visit_SingleAssignmentNode(self, node):

comment_data.body: Yep, I will make sure this gets done once I know how to enable offloading in the CI. Any suggestions for that will be appreciated.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,196 @@
+.. highlight:: cython
+
+.. _device_offload:
+
+********************************
+Offloading to a Device
+********************************
+
+Basic Usage
+===========
+
+Cython supports offloading code blocks to a GPU device.
+Currently only parallel blocks (see :ref:'Using Parallelism <parallel>')
+can be offloaded to a target device. The current implementation is based
+on the OpenMP 'target' directive.
+
+.. NOTE:: The offload functionality is experimental.
+
+.. NOTE:: Offloading to a device is only possible for code blocks which
+          do not require the Python interpreter. There is no way to use
+          Python objects on the device.
+
+Let's consider a simple example for computing pairwise distances between vectors in ``parallel``::
+
+    def pairwise_distance_host(double[:, ::1] X):

comment_data.body:
Ah - fair enough. I can see why you need it. Two possible options to consider:

1. Could you change the utility code to make the `__PYX_INC_MEMVIEW` macro evaluate to nothing on the device?
2. I have [a PR possibly pending](https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3377) that tries to re-arrange how the various put_xxxref functions are generated. I'm not sure you'd be well-advised to rely on a PR that may not be accepted or may have to be modified to be accepted. However, the advantage would be that you could make a dedicated `DeviceMemviewSlice` type that inherits from the normal `MemviewSlice` type but doesn't generate reference counting. (If you were to consider this option I'd probably leave your code as is for now, and see what happens with my PR)

There may of course be other, better options which aren't obvious to me.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2129,7 +2129,7 @@ def put_xdecref_clear(self, cname, type, nanny=True, clear_before_decref=False):
                          clear=True, clear_before_decref=clear_before_decref)
 
     def _put_decref(self, cname, type, nanny=True, null_check=False,
-                    have_gil=True, clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):
+                    have_gil='gil', clear=False, clear_before_decref=False):

commit.message: adding 'device' directive: generating openmp target with map-clauses
adding error label
use variables only for map clauses
allow only c-contiguous arrays; accept 'map' keyword arg in device()
fixing map clauses, using teams and distribute when on device
make device directive data-context only and accept device argument to parallel
allow device in gil mode; simple compile tests
reverting erroneous line deletion
adding @device
nogil directive
making memview incr/decr device sensitive
device not a modifier, only a directive; auto-enabling nogil if device
omp declare privates on outer loop, since inner loops are not 'omp parallel for'ified
omp declare privates on outer loop, since inner loops are not 'omp parallel for'ified
loop-privates must not propagate beyond outer loop
merge
use safe defaults for map clauses, leave optimizations for later
always create a ParallelWithBlockNode if using prange
allow nogil in parallel() and propagate from prange
use default map, not tofrom
correcting propagation of nigil and num_threads in thight prange
initing nogil and device
initial dynamic check of memview_is_contig
better type-handling in maps
support for pointer with explicit count; use teams only for tight pranges
try to support self
allow memviews on structs
no python-obj cleanup in device-functions; use omp parallel not teams
removing Python error handling in device code
adding initial draft of device-offload doc
